intro: Sericanthe adamii, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a vibrant display to its surroundings. The plant has compound leaves with multiple leaflets, and it produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. Sericanthe adamii thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species in warm climates. Its botanical features make it both visually appealing and ecologically significant in its native habitat.
